intro: Lasiobema yunnanense, commonly known as Yunnan lasionympha, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals and a distinctive calyx. It typically grows at elevations above 2,000 meters, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
